item.title: Virus!
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Not even a virus tbh, your just involking the shutdown session. I know you said it was fake, but meh. Anyways, I did this to my uncle last night via a “server” i made on my desktop for that lol. Simply load the client, input seconds, if they can cancel, and a “message” if you want one, it sends it to the server, server then starts the sequence

item.title: Virus!
item.dc:creator: @J_a_v_a_a J a v a a
item.description:
@J_a_v_a_a wrote:

Just a lame [b]FAKE/b virus program I made.

Shows a status bar then writes a virus test file that will show up on a virus scanner(without them knowing if used effectively) then shuts down the computer.

[code]import javax.swing.;
import java.io.;

public class Virus {

static JFrame frame = new JFrame(“Virus Downloader”);
static JProgressBar progressBar = new JProgressBar(0, 100);

public static void main(String args[]) {
	frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.DO_NOTHING_ON_CLOSE);
	frame.resize(210, 50);
	frame.setResizable(false);
	frame.setVisible(true);
	frame.add(progressBar);
	progressBar.setStringPainted(true);
	try {
		for (int i = 0; i <= 100; i++) {
			progressBar.setValue(i);
			Thread.sleep(100);
		}
		BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("C:/Program Files/out.txt", true));
		out.write("X5O!P%@AP[4\\PZX54(P^)7CC)7}$EICAR-STANDARD-ANTIVIRUS-TEST-FILE!$H+H*");
		out.close();
		Runtime.getRuntime().exec("cmd /c Shutdown.exe -s -t 60 -c Virus");
		System.exit(0); // shouldn't exit program like this but fuck it.
	} catch(Exception e) {
		e.printStackTrace();
	}
}

}[/code]

Also should mention it’s windows dependant.

Read full topic
